topic.title: How to process backlog transactions in Karaf incidents

body.p: Apache Karaf incidents often create massive backlogs of unprocessed transactions that arrived in the queue when the agent was not operational. After the blockage has already been removed and the incident has been resolved, multiple transactions need to be processed to clear the backlog. This should be done one by one in order not to overload the application with too many files at a time, but with hundreds of transactions, moving the files from one folder to another by hand is not an efficient way to do it.
There are two methods to automate this task and process the transactions one at a time, with a five second delay between each transaction. Follow the links below to learn more about each method:
